caption:
This photograph depicts a classroom setting from around the 1970s or 1980s, capturing a group of students engaged in typing or office skills training. The focal point of the image is a young woman seated in the center, wearing a black sweater and large, round eyeglasses. She has short, dark hair and is looking slightly towards the left with a focused but relaxed expression.

The student is working on a typewriter, a tan and dark brown Remington model, which is positioned on top of her desk. In front of her, there is an open textbook or manual, propped up for easy viewing as she types. Her workspace also includes a few stacked books and papers beside the typewriter.

Surrounding the central figure, there are other students, mostly female, visible in the classroom. The scene shows the backs of two heads in the foreground; one of them has short hair and wears a patterned blouse, and the other has longer, straight hair and wears a dark jacket or sweater. In the background to the right, another student, dressed in a light patterned blouse, can be seen working at her desk.

The classroom environment appears typical of the era, with simple furniture and a no-nonsense educational setup focused on practical skills. The overall ambiance of the room conveys a sense of quiet concentration and the earnest pursuit of learning a vocational skill.
title: Students in typing class at senior high school in New Ulm Minnesota.  The town is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota.  It was founded in 1854 by a german immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from europe.  Several manufacturing firms have located here and have helped the town to grow.  The business district was revitalized during the 1960's with community effort
